meanings.definition: to join, to become a member of (an organization, group, etc.)
meanings.english_definition: to become a part of a group, company, or organization
examples: Ele decidiu incorporar-se ao clube de xadrez.
Ele decidiu se incorporar ao clube de xadrez.
He decided to join the chess club.

meanings.definition: to sit up, to rise from a lying position
meanings.english_definition: to raise oneself to a sitting position
examples: Ele incorporou-se na cama, sentindo-se tonto.
Ele se incorporou na cama, sentindo-se tonto.
He sat up in bed, feeling dizzy.

meanings.definition: to become embodied, to be expressed in a physical form
meanings.english_definition: to be embodied or expressed in a physical form
examples: A raiva incorporou-se em seu rosto.
A raiva se incorporou em seu rosto.
The anger became embodied in his face.

meanings.english_definition: to be drafted or enlisted into the military
examples: Ele foi obrigado a incorporar-se no exército.
Ele foi obrigado a se incorporar no exército.
He was forced to join the army.

notes: This is a reflexive verb, meaning it requires a reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, vos, se). The reflexive pronoun can be placed before or after the conjugated verb form, following standard Portuguese reflexive verb rules. The placement after is more common in writing, especially in Brazil. Both 'incorporar-se' and 'se incorporar' are correct, but the latter is more common in speech.

etymology.value: From Latin 'incorporare', meaning 'to embody, to include in a body'.

regional_variations.Brazil: The form 'se incorporar' is more common in spoken Brazilian Portuguese.
regional_variations.Portugal: Both 'incorporar-se' and 'se incorporar' are used, but 'incorporar-se' may be slightly more formal.
